title: How to Forget a Wi-Fi Network on Your Android: Step-by-Step Guide

steps.title: Open your Android's Settings app.
steps.content: Open your Android's Settings app. The Settings icon looks like a gray gear or wrench icon on most Android devices.

steps.title: Navigate to your connection settings.
steps.content: Navigate to your connection settings. The name of this menu item will vary between Android models. On a Google Pixel, you should look for Network & internet and on a Samsung, look for Connections . [1] X Research source [2] X Research source

steps.title: Select the internet or Wi-Fi option.
steps.content: Select the internet or Wi-Fi option. The name of this menu item will vary between Android models. On a Google Pixel, you should look for Internet and on a Samsung, look for Wi-Fi . If your Wi-Fi isn't on, you may need to enable it before adjusting network settings.

steps.title: Select the network you want to forget.
steps.content: Select the network you want to forget. On Google Pixel, you will need to press and hold. On a Samsung, tap on the network.

steps.title: Select the cogwheel icon on Samsung only.
steps.content: Select the cogwheel icon on Samsung only. After you select the network you want to forget, you must select the cogwheel button to open the network settings.

steps.title: Tap Forget.
steps.content: Tap Forget . Your device will disconnect from this network and stop connecting to it automatically. If you want to connect to the same Wi-Fi network again in the future, you will have to re-enter the password, as your phone won't have the information stored anymore.
